byline.contributor: Somini Sengupta contributed reporting from New York.

abstract: Exiled Yemeni government agrees to peace talks with Houthi rebels in attempt to end Yemeni civil war.
lead_paragraph: The Houthis had previously indicated their willingness to attend the talks, which could be held in the next few weeks in Geneva, diplomats said.

headline.main: Exiled Yemen Government Agrees to Peace Talks With Houthi Rebels
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Middle East; Yemen: An Agreement to Talk

snippet: The Houthis had previously indicated their willingness to attend the talks, which could be held in the next few weeks in Geneva, diplomats said.

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
